snippet.title: State of Origin 2017: The decider
snippet.content:
The New South Wales Blues team during a walk ahead of their State of Origin III clash against the Queensland Maroons in Brisbane. Photo: AAP
When the State of Origin series comes down to a game three decider, emotions run high among sports fans. Add into the the mix that a number of Queensland greats may just well be farewelling the State of Origin arena, and there's peak anxiety - on both sides of the border! Of course, there are opinions galore. The 's generally genial NRL podcast, takes on mini-confrontational tones often heard at this time of the season. Listen here. No Inglis, no Boyd, no Thurston and no Scott, there's no hope, says Andrew Moir. , he says. His colleague Ellen Ebsary disagrees.
is happy to be watching it from the couch. "I'm looking forward to it," Weyman said. "If you looked at the 120 minutes of play so far, NSW was the better team." RELATED READING
